etymologies: mid 16th century (in an earlier sense). Apparently a variant of embassy, influenced by ambassade and ambassador

notes.text: Embassy is now the usual term (see note on spelling history in etymology)

definitions: A political or diplomatic mission or negotiation.

A person or group sent on a political or diplomatic mission; an ambassador and his or her advisers, assistants, etc.; the staff of an ambassador's office. Formerly occasionally also: †the official residence and offices of an ambassador (obsolete).
